Ancestor Totem (Su).Benefits: Gain a +4 Insight Bonus to a skill while raging, and you may use it while raging even if you normally couldn’t

Ancestor Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: Gain a +6 Insight Bonus to a skill while raging, and you may use it while raging even if you normally couldn’t. Once per rage you may spend a round of rage to reroll a skill check of that skill.

Ancestor Totem, Lesser (Su).Benefits: Gain a +2 Insight Bonus to a skill (that you can use while raging) while raging

Armor Ripper.Benefits: Gain a bonus to Sunder checks with your natural attacks while raging

Atavism Totem, Lesser (Su).Benefits: You gain a bite attack; or if you already have a bite attack, it deals damage as if you were one size larger.

Auspicious Mark (Su).Benefits: Gain a bonus on a roll once per rage

Battle Roar (Su).Benefits: You deal an additional 1d6 points of sonic damage to an opponent you successfully demoralized using intimidating glare.

Bestial Climber (Ex).Benefits: Climb at your normal land speed while raging

Bestial Leaper (Ex).Benefits: Take a standard action while moving during a rage

Bestial Swimmer (Ex).Benefits: Swim at your normal land speed while raging

Bleeding Blow (Ex).Benefits: Deal bleed damage with your powerful blows

Bloody Bite (Ex).Prerequisites: Half-orc, animal fury rage power or a natural bite attack
Bloody Bite (Ex).Benefits: Your bite attack deals 1d6 points of bleed damage in addition to its other effects.

Bloody Fist (Ex).Benefits: Once per rage, the barbarian may attempt to punch through an opponent’s flesh and rip out one of its vital organs. In order to do so, the barbarian must confirm a critical hit against an opponent with a natural attack or unarmed strike. The barbarian deals damage as normal for a critical hit and the opponent must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC = 10 + 1/2 the barbarian’s class level + the barbarian’s Strength modifier) or take 1d4 points of Constitution damage as one of its vital organs is ripped free from its body.

Boar’s Charge.Benefits: Automatically score critical hits with your gore attack while raging

Boasting Taunt (Ex).Benefits: Force an enemy to attack the barbarian

Body Bludgeon (Ex).Benefits: Beat a foe with another creature

Brawler.Benefits: Gain Improved Unarmed Strike while raging

Breathtaker (Ex).Benefits: While raging, whenever you make a successful melee attack against an opponent that is holding its breath, in addition to any other effects caused by that attack, the opponent loses a number of rounds of breath equal to your Strength modifier.

Celestial Totem.Benefits: Gain a halo that shines as daylight and triggers invisibility purge (only reveals non-good creatures) in the barbarian’s square and each adjacent square.

Celestial Totem, Greater.Benefits: Gain SR while raging equal to 11 + barbarian class level against spells with the evil descriptor; also gain +2 bonus on all saves against spells and effects from evil creatures.

Celestial Totem, Lesser.Benefits: Whenever subjected to a spell that cures hp damage, heal 1 additional hp per caster level. In the case of non-spell healing effects (such as channeled energy or lay on hands), heal a number of additional hp equal to the class level of the character performing the magical healing.

Chaos Totem (Su).Benefits: Gain a bonus to Escape Artist and a chance to avoid critical hits

Chaos Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: Gain DR/lawful and weapons count as chaotic

Chaos Totem, Lesser (Su).Benefits: Gain a deflection bonus to AC and a resistance bonus against lawful spells and creatures

Come and Get Me (Ex).Benefits: Provoke attacks of opportunity to get extra attacks

Crippling Blow (Ex).Benefits: Deal Strength or Dexterity damage with your powerful blows

Cult Totem, Lesser (Ex).Benefits: While the barbarian is raging, any morale bonuses or bonuses for flanking she gains on attacks rolls are added to her damage rolls instead of her attack rolls. They are still morale bonuses, and they don’t stack with other morale bonuses on damage rolls.

Cult Totem (Ex).Prerequisites: Barbarian 6, lesser cult totem rage power
Cult Totem (Ex).Benefits: The barbarian can make an attack of opportunity against a creature within her reach who damages an ally of the barbarian with a melee attack. Only the enemy, not the barbarian’s ally, needs to be within the barbarian’s melee reach in order for the barbarian to make this attack of opportunity. Once the barbarian makes an attack of opportunity against a creature with this ability, she can’t use this ability to make an attack of opportunity against the same creature for 24 hours.

Cult Totem, Greater (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 10, lesser cult totem and cult totem rage powers
Cult Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: While the barbarian is raging, when she takes hit point damage that would render her dying or dead, she remains conscious and raging until the end of her next turn after taking that damage, though she is disabled during that turn. She becomes dying or dead at the end of her next turn as normal for her current hit point total. This ability has no effect if the barbarian dies from a cause other than hit point damage, such as from a death effect or if her Constitution damage exceeds her Constitution score.

Daemon Totem, Lesser (Su).Benefits: While raging, the barbarian gains a +2 bonus on saving throws against acid damage, death effects, disease, and poison. This bonus increases by 1 for each daemon totem rage power the barbarian has, excluding this one.

Daemon Totem (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 6, lesser daemon totem rage power
Daemon Totem (Su).Benefits: While the barbarian is raging, her melee attacks impose a temporary negative level on her opponent on a successful critical hit. After 1 hour, these temporary negative levels disappear automatically (without a saving throw).

Daemon Totem, Greater (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 10, lesser daemon totem, daemon totem rage powers
Daemon Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: If the barbarian kills an intelligent creature with a CR equal to at least half her character level while raging, she heals 5 hit points. If she is already at her maximum number of hit points, she instead gains 5 temporary hit points, which don’t stack if she kills multiple creatures.

Deadly Accuracy (Ex).Benefits: On critical threat when using surprise accuracy, double surprise accuracy bonus on roll to confirm critical hit.

Deathless Frenzy.Benefits: Ignore all consequences of being at 0 or lower hit points for one round while raging

Disemboweling Tusks.Benefits: While raging, deal Con damage when you confirm a critical hit with your gore attack

Disruptive.Benefits: Gain the Disruptive feat as a bonus feat

Dragon Totem Wings (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 10, dragon totem, dragon totem resilience
Dragon Totem Wings (Su).Benefits: Gain wings and a fly speed while raging

Eater of Magic (Su).Benefits: Take a second saving throw and gain temp hp

Elemental Rage (Su).Benefits: Deal extra elemental damage with melee attacks

Elemental Rage, Greater (Su).Benefits: Deal extra elemental damage on critical hits with melee weapons

Elemental Rage, Lesser (Su).Benefits: Use a swift action to cause extra elemental damage with melee attacks

Energy Absorption (Su).Benefits: Absorb energy to gain temporary hit points

Energy Eruption (Su).Benefits: Store absorbed energy and release it as a breath weapon attack

Energy Resistance (Ex).Benefits: Gain resistance to one type of elemental damage

Energy Resistance, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Halve damage from an elemental attack

Fearless Rage (Ex).Benefits: Become immune to the shaken and frightened conditions

Feasting Bite (Ex).Prerequisites: Half-orc, bloody bite rage power and either the animal fury rage power or a natural bite attack
Feasting Bite (Ex).Benefits: When the barbarian confirms a critical hit with her bite attack, she regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Activating this ability consumes 1 round of rage.

Feast of Blood (Su).Benefits: While raging, the barbarian may feast on the organs of her foes and absorb their power.

Ferocious Beast (Ex).Benefits: Your animal companion also gains the benefits of rage though you must spend 1 additional round of rage per round if companion begins or ends its turn adjacent to you, and 2 additional rounds of rage per round if not.

Ferocious Beast, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Your animal companion shares the benefits of your rage powers that are constant in effect but gains no benefit from rage powers that require actions to activate, even if they are free actions.

Ferocious Mount (Ex).Benefits: Allow your mount to rage as well

Ferocious Mount, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Allow your mount to benefit from rage powers

Ferocious Trample (Ex).Benefits: While raging your mount gains the trample ability

Ferocious Trample, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Your mount can trample larger creatures and make overrun attacks while raging

Fiend Totem (Su).Benefits: Attackers take damage when they hit you in melee

Fiend Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: Non-evil creatures adjacent to the barbarian take damage and are shaken

Fierce Fortitude (Ex).Benefits: You gain a +4 bonus on saving throws against diseases and poison. A skald must be trained in Intimidate to select this rage power.

Fight Response (Ex).Benefits: When a barbarian with this rage power attempts a saving throw against a fear effect, she can enter a rage as an immediate action (as long as she would normally be able to enter rage). This consumes 3 rounds of the barbarian’s daily allotment of rage rounds, but the barbarian can maintain the rage each round on her turn normally. Any benefits from the barbarian’s rage apply immediately, so she gains her bonus on Will saves against the effect that required the initial saving throw. Unlike most rage powers, this rage power’s effects are useful only when the barbarian is not raging, so a skald can’t grant this rage power to allies with raging song.

Flesh Wound (Ex).Benefits: Convert lethal damage to nonlethal damage

Fueled by Vengeance.Benefits: Gain an extra round of rage if you hit a creature that hit you this round while raging

Gearbreaker (Ex).Benefits: Once per round while raging, whenever you make an attack against a construct, you can ignore an amount of that construct’s hardness equal to your barbarian level. This ability must be used before the attack roll is made. This power stacks with hard hitter.

Ghost Rager (Su).Benefits: Deal normal damage to incorporeal creatures

Good for What Ails You (Ex).Benefits: Drink alcohol to gain a new save against conditions

Greater Animal Fury (Ex).Benefits: As animal fury, but your bite attack deals damage as if you were one size larger.

Ground Breaker (Ex).Benefits: Attack the ground to create difficult terrain

Ground Breaker, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Extend ground breaker’s radius of difficult terrain

Guarded Life (Ex).Benefits: Stabilize when at negative hit points

Guarded Life, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Convert more damage to nonlethal damage

Guarded Stance (Ex).Benefits: Gain a dodge bonus to AC

Hive Totem (Su).Benefits: Take half damage from swarms while raging

Hive Totem Resilience (Su).Benefits: Take no damage from swarms while raging

Hive Totem Toxicity (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 8, hive totem, hive totem resilience
Hive Totem Toxicity (Su).Benefits: Do Constitution damage with a bite while raging

Hurling (Ex).Benefits: Increase the range and size allowed for a hurled object

Hurling, Greater (Ex).Benefits: Increase the range and size allowed for a hurled object

Hurling, Lesser (Ex).Benefits: You can lift and throw large objects to do damage

Hurling Charge (Ex).Benefits: You can hurl an object as part of a charge

Impelling Disarm (Ex).Benefits: Once per rage, you may attempt to hit another opponent with a weapon you disarmed from a different opponent.

Inspire Ferocity (Ex).Benefits: Use a move action to share reckless abandon with allies

Internal Fortitude (Ex).Benefits: Gain immunity to nauseated and sickened conditions

Intimidating Glare (Ex).Benefits: Intimidate an opponent as a move action

Knockback (Ex).Benefits: Make a bull rush in place of a melee attack

Knockdown (Ex).Benefits: Make a trip attack in place of a melee attack

Lethal Accuracy (Ex).Benefits: Deal more damage when you score a critical hit with surprise accuracy

Linnorm Death Curse, Cairn (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of negative energy damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of decay (Will negates).

Linnorm Death Curse, Crag (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of fire damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of fire (Will negates).

Linnorm Death Curse, Fjord (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of cold damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of drowning (Will negates).

Linnorm Death Curse, Ice (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of cold damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed, the attacker suffers the curse of frost.

Linnorm Death Curse, Taiga (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of electricity damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of electricity (Will negates).

Linnorm Death Curse, Tarn (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of acid damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of death (Will negates).

Linnorm Death Curse, Tor (Su).Benefits: Your melee attacks deal an additional 1 point of fire damage. If the character is knocked unconscious or killed by an attack or spell, the attacker suffers the curse of boiling blood (Will negates).

Liquid Courage (Ex).Benefits: Alcoholic beverages give you a morale bonus while raging

Moment of Clarity (Ex).Benefits: Remove benefits and penalties of raging for 1 round

Night Vision (Ex).Prerequisites: Low-light vision rage power or racial low-light vision

No Escape (Ex).Benefits: Double move as an immediate action when an opponent withdraws

Overbearing Advance (Ex).Benefits: Deal extra damage when using the overrun maneuver

Penetrating Bite (Ex).Benefits: When using animal fury while raging, your bite is able to pierce most resistances.

Perfect Clarity (Ex).Benefits: Roll twice when disbelieving an illusion

Powerful Blow (Ex).Benefits: Deal extra damage with a single blow

Primal Scent (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus when using scent

Quick Reflexes (Ex).Benefits: Make additional attacks of opportunity while raging

Raging Climber (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus on Climb checks while raging

Raging Flier (Su).Benefits: 1/rage, fly up to your base speed as a move action and can use this flight as part of movement during a charge.

Raging Grappler (Ex).Benefits: While raging, whenever you succeed at a check to start a grapple, you can choose to deal damage as if you had also succeeded at a check to maintain the grapple. In addition, while raging, whenever you succeed at a combat maneuver check to maintain a grapple, you can choose to give yourself, the target of your grapple, or both the prone condition as a free action while continuing to maintain the grapple.

Raging Leaper (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus on Acrobatics checks to jump while raging

Raging Swimmer (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus on Swim checks while raging

Reckless Abandon (Ex).Benefits: Take a penalty to AC for extra accuracy while raging

Reflexive Dodge (Ex).Benefits: Use your rolling dodge bonus on Reflex saving throws

Regenerative Vigor (Ex).Benefits: Gain fast healing after using renewed vigor

Renewed Life (Ex).Benefits: Ignore temporary negative levels while raging

Renewed Vigor (Ex).Benefits: Heal damage as a standard action

Renewed Vitality (Ex).Benefits: Ignore ability damage or penalties while raging

Roaring Drunk (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus on Intimidate checks and fear effect DC

Rolling Dodge (Ex).Benefits: Gain a dodge bonus to AC against ranged attacks while raging

Roused Anger (Ex).Benefits: Enter a rage even when fatigued

Savage Dirty Trick (Ex).Benefits: Once per round while raging, you can attempt a dirty trick combat maneuver in place of a melee attack.

Savage Intuition.Benefits: You may enter a rage even if you aren’t aware that combat has begun

Savage Jaw (Ex).Benefits: While raging, you can open your jaws wide and latch your teeth firmly onto your opponent.

Scent (Ex).Benefits: Gain the scent ability when raging

Sharpened Accuracy (Ex).Benefits: Surprise accuracy ignores concealment and cover

Smasher (Ex).Benefits: When sundering an unattended object, ignore hardness

Spell Sunder (Su).Benefits: Sunder spells with a combat maneuver check

Spellbreaker.Benefits: Gain the Spellbreaker feat while raging

Spirit Steed (Su).Benefits: Your mount gains DR/magic and its natural weapons count as magical

Spirit Totem (Su).Benefits: Attacks against you may miss when you are raging

Spirit Totem, Greater (Su).Benefits: Enemies near you take negative energy damage

Spirit Totem, Lesser (Su).Benefits: Gain spirit allies that can attack adjacent enemies

Sprint (Ex).Benefits: Move at x3 or x6 speed once per rage

Staggering Drunk (Ex).Benefits: Gain dodge AC against attacks of opportunity if drinking

Strength Surge (Ex).Benefits: Gain a Strength bonus on Combat Maneuver Checks

Superstition (Ex).Benefits: Gain a bonus on saving throws

Surprise Accuracy (Ex).Benefits: Gain a morale bonus on one attack roll

Terrifying Howl (Ex).Benefits: Cause shaken enemies to become panicked

Ultimate Clarity (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 6, moment of clarity, perfect clarity
Ultimate Clarity (Su).Benefits: 1/rage, for 1 round, see through normal and magical darkness (including from magical effects such as blur and displacement), invisibility, and illusions; and discern exact locations of creatures with concealment.

Unexpected Strike (Ex).Benefits: Enemies provoke attacks of opportunity even when they normally wouldn’t

Water Sense (Ex).Benefits: Your senses are no longer fooled by the rippling surface and confounding reflections seen in water that is being used as cover by your foes.

World Serpent Totem (Su).Benefits: Gain bonuses against outsiders and abberations

World Serpent Spirit (Su).Benefits: Your weapon counts as chaotic, evil, good, lawful while raging

World Serpent Totem Unity (Su).Prerequisites: Barbarian 6, world serpent spirit, world serpent totem
World Serpent Totem Unity (Su).Benefits: Double fast movement bonus and cannot be knocked prone
